citation_title: Entrepreneurship and Financial Frictions: A Macro-Development Perspective
topics:
Industrial Organization

Firm Behavior

Development and Growth

Development

Growth and Productivity
program:
Development Economics

Economic Fluctuations and Growth

Productivity, Innovation, and Entrepreneurship
abstract: We review both the theoretical and empirical literature on entrepreneurship and financial frictions, with an emphasis on the heterogeneous and dynamic micro-level implications of financial frictions for macro development.
acknowledgement:
The views expressed herein are those of the authors and do not necessarily reflect the views of the National Bureau of Economic Research, the Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago or the Federal Reserve System. This is a draft working version of a paper prepared for the Annual Review of Economics, doi: 10.1146/annurev-economics-080614-115348.



Joseph P. Kaboski

Kaboski has outside financial relationships with the International Monetary Fund for a financial inclusion course and lectures on inclusive growth, and Korean Development Institute for research on human capital.  I have a research grant from the National Institute of Health for a separate project involving microfinance and entrepreneurship in Uganda.
